title: Minus Peterson, KU hands No. 1 Arizona first loss
content: Flory Bidunga had a double-double and No. 9 Kansas defeated top-ranked and previously unbeaten Arizona 82-78 on Monday night.

title: Four tossed after brawl in Pistons-Hornets game
content: A fight broke out between the Pistons and Hornets on Monday night, leading to the ejections of Charlotte's Moussa Diabate and Miles Bridges and Detroit's Jalen Duren and Isaiah Stewart.

title: 49ers DL White shot in ankle in San Francisco
content: 49ers defensive lineman Keion White underwent surgery Monday after he was shot in the ankle in San Francisco hours after Super Bowl LX concluded.

title: Judge denies Bediako's motion to play for Alabama
content: An Alabama circuit judge on Monday denied Alabama basketball player Charles Bediako's motion for a preliminary injunction, ending the 7-foot center's college eligibility and his season with the Crimson Tide.

title: Vonn says she suffered complex tibia fracture
content: Lindsey Vonn said Monday in a post on Instagram that she suffered a complex tibia fracture "that will require multiple surgeries to fix properly" when she crashed in the downhill Sunday.

title: Raiders officially name Kubiak new head coach
content: The Raiders officially announced Klint Kubiak as the team's new head coach Monday, a day after he helped the Seahawks win Super Bowl LX.

title: Njoku confirms longtime Browns tenure is over
content: Impending free agent tight end David Njoku, who has played his first nine years in the NFL with the Browns, will not return to Cleveland in 2026.

title: Indiana to build statue in honor of Coach Knight
content: Indiana plans to build a bronze statue of Hall of Fame coach Bob Knight that will be displayed alongside the 1976 national championship statues in the lobby of Simon Skjodt Assembly Hall.

title: 'It's going to be an intense one': U.S-Canada in women's hockey is one of the best rivalries in sports
content: How is each team playing? Who are the key players in Tuesday's preliminary-round game? We break down the first meeting between the rivals at the 2026 Winter Olympics.

title: 'A glitch in the matrix': How does Ilia Malinin do what seems impossible?
content: Figure skater Ilia Malinin intends to land a quad axel -- along with other unique tricks -- at the Winter Olympics

title: What Klint Kubiak hire means for Las Vegas: two-RB system, more 12-personnel and a potential Mendoza pairing
content: The Raiders hired Klint Kubiak. Here's what that means for Las Vegas, plus what's next in the offseason.

title: Drake Maye lost his first Super Bowl. His future -- and the Patriots' -- remains bright
content: Drake Maye and the Patriots weren't able to do much in Super Bowl LX, but their future might still be bright.

title: Next season already? Our Way-Too-Early NFL Power Rankings stack all 32 teams for 2026
content: After the conclusion of the 2025 NFL season, how do all 32 teams stack up for 2026? Here are our early rankings for next season.

title: Offseason guide for every NFL team
content: What must each team do to have a better season in 2026? We have outlooks, early buzz and predictions.

title: What this NBA trade deadline revealed: Teams are finding new ways to tank
content: Much to the irritation of some league insiders, the trade deadline was more than just a flurry of moves: It showed the next evolution in teams racing to the bottom.

title: Men's Bubble Watch: Iowa's inch to lock status, more results from a packed weekend
content: Iowa, USC pulled out wins but Ohio State, UCF, West Virginia, Tulsa have work to do after a mixed bubble Sunday.

title: What the Charles Bediako ruling means for Alabama and future NCAA eligibility cases
content: The former two-way NBA player's request to keep playing for his old college team was denied. Here's what it means.

title: Women's AP Top 25 poll reaction: Duke up, Louisville down, UConn still the 1
content: The No. 11 Blue Devils were the biggest mover in the women's AP Top 25 poll. Here's what's next for every team.

title: Bracketology: Are the No. 1 seeds already locked in?
content: Texas' win over LSU on Thursday makes it tougher for teams such as the Tigers or Vanderbilt to get to a 1-seed.

title: Making sense of Super Bowl LX: The Seahawks mixed up their game plan, and the Patriots couldn't adapt
content: Let's size up Seattle's defensive wrinkles, an explosive RB, great special teams and Sam Darnold's performance.

title: Nothing left to prove, resilient Sam Darnold makes ultimate statement
content: The QB isn't motivated to prove the haters wrong, but to prove people right. And on Sunday, he did just that.

title: An inside look at how an Olympic ice dance routine is crafted
content: With '90s music as the theme for the 2026 Winter Olympics, ice dance routines have included everything from Madonna to the Spice Girls.

title: Super Bowl records: Who holds the all-time marks after the Seahawks beat the Patriots?
content: Here is a look at Super Bowl records such as most points, most touchdowns and Tom Brady's all-time totals.

title: We ranked every Super Bowl champion, 1-60: How do the 2025 Seahawks stack up?
content: How good was the 2025 Seahawks team? We ranked the Super Bowl LX winner against the other 59 champions.

title: UWCL playoff round preview: Can Arsenal maintain winning momentum?
content: The inaugural UWCL playoff round begins this week, with a host of big clubs -- including Arsenal -- fighting for a spot in the quarterfinals. Here's what you need to know about all four match-ups.

title: Klopp, Alonso, Guardiola: Predicting what happens to Europe's top managers this summer
content: With the Real Madrid and Manchester United jobs up for grabs, one thing is for certain this summer: The world's best managers will be in high demand.

title: Man City's comeback thriller keeps title hopes alive; Liverpool slip further
content: Man City's two unanswered goals means the title race stays alive and Liverpool's UCL hopes are in doubt.

title: NFL playoffs top moments: From Caleb Williams' miracle TD to the Super Bowl MVP﻿
content: Here's a look at the wild and woolly NFL postseason, from frigid temperatures to trick plays and Super Bowl MVPs.

title: NFL futures: Champion Seahawks, Rams atop Super Bowl LXI odds
content: A champion was just crowned, but it's never too early to look ahead. Here are the odds for Super Bowl LXI.

title: Too soon? Early bets to win Super Bowl LXI
content: We're already thinking about Super Bowl LXI. Here are the contenders and odds that caught our analysts' eyes.

title: America's team: How Cadillac's arrival is already shaking up F1
content: Cadillac is unveiling its first F1 livery in a Super Bowl commercial Sunday night, revealing just how big America's team ambitions are.

title: Fantasy basketball pickups: Collier, Mathurin, Clifford among top players to add
content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Al Nassr could replace Ronaldo with Salah
content: Al Nassr are looking at Mohamed Salah as a possible replacement for Cristiano Ronaldo. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: ED summons actor Jayaram for questioning in Sabarimala gold case
content: Move comes in the wake of Jayaram’s association and reported financial transactions with Unnikrishnan Potti, the prime accused in the case. Actor summoned for questioning next week

title: Parliament Budget Session Day 10 LIVE: BJP’s women MPs urge Speaker to take action against Opposition MPs
content: Rahul Gandhi and some other MPs met Mr. Birla to work out a solution to end the stalemate, as the House has not been functioning properly

title: Haryana: Faridabad DCP (NIT) transferred after Surajkund mela tragedy
content: Faridabad DCP (NIT) Maqsood Ahmed transfer comes close on the heels of a swing collapse incident at the Surajkund fairgrounds in Faridabad, in which an on-duty police inspector died during rescue efforts, and 12 others were injured.

title: ED to issue fresh summons to Tina Ambani
content: It is understood that she was called for questioning with regard to a money trail linked to the purchase of a luxury condominium in New York's Manhattan

title: Journalist arrested for objectionable Facebook post on U.P. CM Adityanath in Ballia
content: Citing the FIR, police said the accused posted an objectionable image of UP CM on Facebook on Sunday, accompanied by a controversial caption.

title: BJP’s women MPs urge Speaker to take action against Opposition MPs for Feb. 4 ruckus
content: The women MPs of the BJP also said that the "alarming turn of events" in the precincts of the Lok Sabha on February 4 has left everyone deeply concerned

title: Sunetra Pawar to take charge as first woman Deputy CM of Maharashtra today
content: Pawar was chosen as the group leader for the NCP Legislature part following the demise of her husband Ajit Pawar in a tragic air crash in Baramati on January 28, 2026

title: Fire breaks out at Attapur car showroom; no injuries reported
content: As a precautionary measure, around 90 residents from a neighbouring residential apartment were evacuated

title: 18,791 government schools in Karnataka have no land records
content: The government has now taken steps to bring ‘The Karnataka School Education Department Properties Protection Bill 2025 or The Karnataka Protection of Government School/Colleges Properties Bill’ to register the properties of government schools in the name of the DSEL

title: Leo D’Souza, Mangaluru’s Mendel who worked to transform cashew industry
content: Fr Leo built one of India’s earliest plant tissue culture labs and helped crack cashew micropropagation, including a test-tube cashew tree that made it to the soil; he leaves behind a rare Jesuit legacy that fused rigorous science with public purpose, shaping women scientists and vulnerable lives alike

title: GSDP growth of State has outpaced national average, says planning official
content: Andhra Pradesh’s GSDP is estimated at ₹17.62 lakh crore, reflecting a growth of 10.75%, says State Planning Department Principal Secretary Piyush Kumar

title: Why is there a caste-system for trains, asks PAC
content: A BJP member pointed out that there appears to be a “caste system” in trains, with premium services such as the Vande Bharat offering superior linen and cleaner coaches compared to regular passenger trains

title: Naveen Patnaik attacks Mohan Majhi government over paddy procurement
content: Thousands of farmers are spending sleepless nights under the open sky, guarding their paddy from dew and theft, as the lifting of stocks remains agonisingly slow, alleges former CM

title: West Bengal remains destination and source of Bonded Labour
content: Poor workers from Bihar, Jharkhand, and Odisha work as bonded laborers in brick kilns, while the State is also source of youths who end up being bonded labourers in Chennai’s jewellery manufacturing units

title: Indore water contamination: Inquiry panel issued public notice to seek evidence
content: The panel has been tasked with investigating the causes of water pollution, administrative negligence, action against responsible individuals, loss of life, medical effects, and remedial measures

title: Delhi High Court seeks CBI stand on Jaideep Sengar’s plea for extension of interim bail
content: The brother of expelled BJP leader, who was awarded a 10-year jail term in the case by the trial court, said his interim bail was expiring on February 11 and sought an extension as he was suffering from oral cancer

title: No copies of Naravane’s memoir have gone into publication: Publisher
content: The clarification came after the Delhi Police registered an FIR over the alleged illegal circulation of the manuscript in digital and other formats

title: ‘BJP leader’ booked for beating woman in M.P.; video goes viral
content: Such instances are reported regularly; BJP leaders, drunk on power, are seen perpetrating atrocities against women, the Congress said

title: Operating and maintenance costs, Consumer Price Index among parameters to recalculate metro fare
content: Responding to allegations that the State government had sought the fare hike, the Deputy Chief Minister maintained that the decision had been taken much earlier by an independent fare fixation committee

title: Hosur airport not recommended to prioritise defence projects of national importance, says Civil Aviation Minister
content: He was responding to a question raised by DMK MP S. Kalyanasundaram in the Rajya Sabha on whether the Centre has examined the Hosur airport proposal sent by the State government and the reasons for the delay in granting in-principle approval, airspace clearance and other such permissions

title: Indian coffee steadily moving from commodity-led  to quality, experience-driven market: Coffee Board
content: The tariff reduction from 25% to zero (0%) would boost India’s coffee exports in general and shipments of speciality coffees in particular, said the coffee community, in response to a media query on the impact of recent U.S. tariff reduction on India's coffee exports

title: TMC welcomes Supreme Court intervention in SIR exercise, calls it big victory for West Bengal
content: The ruling party in the State says the latest development blows apart the ‘ECI’s unilateral move to parachute micro-observers exclusively into Bengal to influence, intimidate, and manipulate the process’

title: Trinamool councillor arrested for allegedly ‘beating elderly man to death’ over illegal construction
content: Arjun Singh, a BJP leader, led a protest march against the Trinamool leader; they scuffled with police and blocked roads; protesters demanded capital punishment and said that the assault was deliberate

title: Workers, employers found Labour Codes credible, forward-looking: government report
content: “The overall perception scores indicate that stakeholders view the Labour Codes as a credible and forward-looking reform, reflecting confidence in their long-term relevance despite the acknowledged transitional nature of the current phase,” a report based on the survey said

title: Lokayukta officials trap Bescom engineer for taking ₹3 lakh bribe in Bengaluru
content: The arrested official has been identified as Rajesh K.V., executive engineer (electrical), E-11 Division, Bescom, Indiranagar

title: Karnataka Government will recalculate Namma Metro fares using Delhi Metro formula: DKS
content: Deputy CM D.K. Shivakumar asserted that it was the State government that had taken the decision to halt the fare revision, rejecting claims by BJP leaders that the Union government had intervened to stop the hike

title: Activists urge stronger enforcement of Bonded Labour Act
content: According to data around 440 people were rescued from January 2023 till date, of them 209 have yet to receive the initial relief of ₹30,000; the State has fallen behind in the proper implementation of the Act say activists

title: Strike decisively against terrorism, Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor tells police
content: Manoj Sinha advises police to collaborate with every individual in society to eradicate terror networks; death anniversary of Afzal Guru passes off peacefully in Kashmir, with no shutdown call

title: Anaemia, blood disorders can distort diabetes test HbA1c results, says study
content: Any condition that affects the quantity, structure, or lifespan of haemoglobin — such as anaemia, haemoglobinopathies, or other red blood cell disorders — can distort HbA1c values and lead to misleading estimates of average blood glucose, the Lancet viewpoint article notes.

title: Indian-origin techie from Karnataka shot dead in ‘targeted’ attack outside Canada mall
content: A 37-year-old Indian tech professional, Chandan Kumar Raja Nandakumar, was killed in a daylight shooting in Toronto. The incident occurred at a busy shopping mall parking lot. Police are investigating the shooting as a targeted attack. Chandan's family in Karnataka is devastated. He had moved to Canada six years ago and worked for LTI Mindtree.

title: T20 WC: Unsettled by Wankhede pitch, Team India must take wicket out of the equation
content: India's T20 World Cup campaign faced an early jolt with a surprisingly difficult Wankhede pitch against the USA. The team management expressed displeasure to the BCCI, as the sluggish track challenged their aggressive batting plans. Team India prefers high-scoring games and must adapt to varying conditions to succeed in the tournament.

title: Anthropic exec Mrinank Sharma announces exit, shares long resignation note
content: Mrinank Sharma, head of Anthropic's Safeguards Research Team, has resigned, with his last day being February 9th. Sharma cited a desire to contribute with full integrity and explore essential questions, including poetic truth alongside scientific truth. He plans to pursue a poetry degree and focus on courageous speech and community building.

title: 'Had you made reciprocal tariffs to zero ...': Piyush Goyal’s cheeky 18% jab at US envoy
content: Union Minister Piyush Goyal humorously linked India's T20 World Cup victory over the US to trade relations, suggesting the US's 18% tariff mirrored their 18% loss margin. He praised the US team's performance, a country new to cricket, while advocating for zero reciprocal tariffs in a light-hearted exchange with the US Ambassador.

title: 'We didn't keep Tendulkar waiting': Growing calls for Vaibhav Sooryavanshi's early India call-up
content: Vaibhav Sooryavanshi, a 14-year-old prodigy, stunned the cricketing world with a record-breaking 175 in the U19 World Cup final, leading India to victory. His performance has reignited the debate on fast-tracking young talents, with Shashi Tharoor drawing parallels to Sachin Tendulkar. However, ICC regulations prevent Sooryavanshi from playing international cricket until March 2026.

title: Google employees send letter to top execs demanding to cut ties with DHS
content: Nearly 1,000 Google employees are demanding the company sever ties with the Department of Homeland Security, citing contracts with ICE and CBP. They allege Google's technology fuels "state violence and repression." The workers seek transparency on contracts and a commitment to end partnerships with agencies they accuse of human rights abuses.

title: ‘If I had died like Nirbhaya, everyone'd believe me’: Unnao survivor seeks death penalty for Sengar
content: The Supreme Court has rejected the bail plea of former BJP leader Kuldeep Singh Sengar. This relates to the custodial death of the Unnao rape survivor's father. The court has directed the Delhi High Court to hear and decide the appeal within three months. The survivor expressed relief and satisfaction with the verdict.

title: Amitabh Bachchan’s neighbour Nirmit Jesrani finally meets Big B after viral Sunday darshan video
content: Nirmit Jesrani, a neighbour of megastar Amitabh Bachchan, has finally met the actor after his earlier video offering a behind-the-scenes glimpse of Bachchan’s iconic Sunday fan interaction went viral on social media. Days after expressing gratitude for the actor’s humility and wishing to meet him, Nirmit shared a new video revealing that his wish had come true.

title: Microsoft appoints its first 'Engineering Quality Head,' and here's why that matters
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella appointed Charlie Bell as the new head of engineering quality, a move occurring as AI-generated code increases alongside reported bugs. This comes amid challenges with Windows 11 reliability and underwhelming Copilot adoption, raising questions about the company's AI strategy and product quality.

title: Best skills to learn for GCC jobs: What employers are really hiring for in the Gulf?
content: GCC economies are rapidly embracing digital transformation, creating a surge in demand for tech-savvy professionals. Skills in AI, data analytics, cybersecurity and cloud computing are paramount. Alongside these, strong soft skills like leadership and adaptability, coupled with a commitment to lifelong learning and understanding localisation policies, are crucial for career success in the region's evolving job market.

title: US and Bangladesh strike new trade deal — key terms of the agreement
content: The United States and Bangladesh have finalized a new trade agreement. This deal lowers tariffs on Bangladeshi exports to the US. In return, Bangladesh will offer better access for American industrial and agricultural products. Both nations are committed to improving trade practices and strengthening economic security.

title: First digital trail emerges in Ghaziabad sisters' suicide case, Phone recovered by police
content: Ghaziabad police are examining a recovered mobile phone, previously owned by one of three sisters who died by suicide. The handset, sold shortly before their deaths, is undergoing forensic analysis for deleted data. Investigators hope digital clues will shed light on the girls' online activities and social media immersion, crucial to understanding the circumstances surrounding their tragic end.

title: T20 World Cup: Pakistan agrees to India match after ICC sops for Bangladesh
content: Pakistan has agreed to play India in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup 2026 on February 15th in Colombo, reversing their boycott. This decision followed extensive talks involving the ICC and Bangladesh Cricket Board. Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif announced the directive, emphasising the outcomes of multilateral discussions and requests from friendly nations.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens above 25,900; BSE Sensex up over 150 points
content: Stock market today: Indian benchmark indices, Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, rose in early trade on Tuesday continuing the ongoing rally post the India-US trade deal announcement. While Nifty50 went above 25,900, BSE Sensex was up over 150 points.

title: Hack of the day: Turn your phone into a Wi-Fi hotspot securely
content: Sudden power outages can halt work, but your smartphone offers a quick fix. Transform your phone into a secure Wi-Fi hotspot to keep your laptop and other devices connected using cellular data.

title: ‘No player bigger than league’: SPL’s stern message as ‘unhappy’ Ronaldo casts shadow
content: Cristiano Ronaldo's future at Al-Nassr is under scrutiny following a Saudi Pro League statement emphasizing no player is bigger than the club or league. This comes as Ronaldo missed recent matches amid reported frustration with club funding, particularly after rival Al-Hilal's signings. Despite his absence, Al-Nassr secured a key victory.

title: 'Jana Nayagan' censor row: Vijay starrer to end legal battle, Madras HC to hear on Feb 10
content: Thalapathy Vijay's 'Jana Nayagan' censor row is nearing an end as the producers have withdrawn their legal battle. The Madras High Court will hear the case for withdrawal on February 10, 2026. This move allows the film's certification process to proceed with the revising committee, potentially paving the way for its delayed release.

title: Watch: Epstein accomplice Maxwell refuses to answer questions; sets condition for Trump
content: Ghislaine Maxwell, serving a 20-year sentence, invoked her Fifth Amendment right before the House Oversight Committee, declining to answer questions. Her lawyer stated she would testify about President Trump and Clinton's innocence if granted clemency, citing a pending habeas petition and claims of an unfair trial.

title: Oil strategy guided by national interest: Foreign secretary Vikram Misri
content: India's oil sourcing strategy will prioritize national interest, avoiding dependence on any single country, stated Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri. Petroleum companies make purchasing decisions based on market conditions, availability, pricing, and risk assessment. The government's primary goal is to ensure adequate, reliable, and fairly priced energy for Indian consumers.

title: Delhi pit death: Cops probe if contractors tried ‘covering up lapses’
content: Police are investigating a potential cover-up in the death of Kamal Dhyani, who fell into a pit. Sub-contractor Rajesh Kumar Prajapati and labourer Yogesh have been arrested, with Prajapati allegedly instructing Yogesh to alter the accident scene. Contractors Himanshu Gupta and Kavish are also sought for questioning.

title: U-turn complete! India vs Pakistan T20 World Cup match set for Colombo on February 15
content: The standoff is over. The Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) has taken a U-turn over their boycott of the February 15 game against India at the T20 World Cup. The much-anticipated India vs Pakistan clash at the T20 World Cup will go ahead as scheduled.

title: ‘Historically new level’: US cuts tariffs on Bangladesh to 19% under new trade deal
content: The United States and Bangladesh have inked a new trade pact, lowering tariffs on Bangladeshi exports to the US to 19%. This agreement, hailed as a significant step, also introduces zero reciprocal tariffs for specific textile and apparel shipments made with US cotton and man-made fibers.

title: Travis Kelce felt 'awkward' with Blake Lively & Ryan Reynolds, reports say
content: As Taylor Swift deals with probably being called to court after her controversial text exchange with Blake Lively was made public, it seems Travis Kelce was never fond of their company. Just a few hours ago, an insider has claimed that Travis Kelce reportedly felt uncomfortable while hanging out with the Hollywood power couple and is now pretty concerned about Taylor Swift.

title: NBA trade rumors: Lakers eye $186m Bucks star to join LeBron & Doncic
content: Trade speculation is intensifying around the Lakers potentially acquiring Giannis Antetokounmpo in the 2026 offseason. A hypothetical framework involves a package of Austin Reaves, Rui Hachimura, Dalton Knecht, Adou Thiero, and multiple future draft picks. This move would create a star-studded trio with LeBron James and Luka Dončić, aiming for immediate championship contention.

title: Fact check: Did Cardi B call Stefon Diggs 'a disgrace' after Super Bowl LX?
content: Many expected Cardi B to stay until the end of the game yesterday, the popular Grammy winner left midway, as fans were quick to notice that the two removed each other from their respective social media accounts as the New England Patriots witnessed a brutal loss against the Seattle Seahawks in Super Bowl LX. While this has sparked chaos, a screenshot of an alleged heated exchange between the two has sparked panic.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock market recommendations for today - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Somil Mehta, Head - Alternate Research, Capital Market Strategy, Mirae Asset Sharekhan, recommends buying Indusind Bank, Grasim Industries, and Torrent Power as top stock picks for February 10, 2026. Below is a detailed analysis:

title: Russia accounts for over 50% plaints by Indian students abroad: MEA
content: Russia has become a major concern for Indian students abroad, with over half of all global complaints regarding exploitation and racial discrimination originating from the country. Data reveals a sharp surge in such incidents, raising serious safety worries for students, particularly those pursuing medical education. Many fear reporting issues due to potential expulsion and visa complications.

title: Nancy Guthrie’s ransom note had a demand with a deadline
content: Eighty-four-year-old Nancy Guthrie, mother of Savannah Guthrie, vanished from her Tucson home on January 31, 2026. Blood matching her DNA and signs of forced entry were found. Ransom notes demanding millions in Bitcoin with escalating deadlines have emerged, though their authenticity remains unconfirmed. The family is pleading for her safe return.

title: Player with many appearances for Pakistan called as Jasdeep's replacement
content: USA fast bowler Jasdeep Singh has been ruled out of the T20 World Cup 2026 with a shoulder injury sustained during a warm-up match against New Zealand. The ICC approved former Pakistan player Ehsan Adil as his replacement. Jasdeep, a key USA bowler with 54 ODI and 31 T20I wickets, was part of their historic 2024 World Cup win over Pakistan. His absence is a big setback for the team.

title: Read, think, don't scroll: PM Modi recalls learning from TOI in Pariksha Pe Charcha
content: Prime Minister Modi emphasized the power of reading newspapers and discussing ideas, a habit from his student days, during Pariksha Pe Charcha. He cautioned against technology's overreach, urging students to use AI as a guide, not a replacement for learning. PM Modi also advised on exam preparation, rest, and avoiding comparisons, highlighting that small habits build a developed nation.

title: India okays $175m package for Seychelles, inks 7 agreements
content: India has announced a $175 million economic package for Seychelles, including a $125 million line of credit and a $50 million grant, to support projects in housing, health, and defence. The two nations also signed seven pacts, strengthening maritime security and cooperation in the Indian Ocean. This collaboration aims to enhance regional stability and counter transnational maritime challenges.

title: 'Jana Nayagan' censor fight moves to final stage: Vijay fans react
content: 'Jana Nayagan' has been stuck in a long censor fight . the film was supposed to release on January 9, 2026 . but the CBFC asked for cuts and then paused the process again . now the producers have changed their mind .

title: 'Act Now': Global Body Flags Rise In Violence Against Hindus In Bangladesh Ahead Of Polls
content: A broad international alliance of human rights organisations, faith groups, and civil society leaders has issued an urgent global appeal warning that Hindus in Bangladesh are facing escalating violence and systematic persecution.

title: Odisha Man Stabs Son To Death Over Ancestral Land Dispute
content: A man in Odisha's Dhenkanal has been arrested for allegedly killing his son during a dispute over ancestral land. The victim, identified as Khirod Sahu, had been involved in a long-standing conflict with his father regarding the property

title: Explained: Who Were The Razakars, How They Brutalised East Pakistan
content: Bangladesh Elections 2026: Razakars were the paramilitary force that was recruited by the Pakistani army during the 1971 Bangladesh Liberation War.

title: "Explain Again": BJP's Maithili Thakur Questions Minister Over Hospital
content: The dilapidated condition of government hospitals once again came into focus in the Bihar Legislative Assembly today during the budget session.

title: 'US Would've Won If Tariffs Zero': Piyush Goyal's T20 Banter With Sergio Gor
content: Union Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal on Monday praised the US cricket team's performance against India in the T20 World Cup, saying they did "fabulously" despite losing.

title: Tina Ambani Skips Probe Agency ED's Summons In Money Laundering Case
content: Businessman Anil Ambani's wife Tina Ambani today skipped summons from the Enforcement Directorate (ED) which is probing money laundering cases allegedly to the tune of Rs 40,000 crore.

title: 1990 Bangladesh Mass Uprising: The Fall Of General Hussain Muhammad Ershad
content: Bangladesh is all set to vote in what's the country's first national election since the removal of former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina in 2024.

title: Parliament Budget Session Day 10 LIVE Updates: Parliament To Resume Budget Discussion Amid Political Stalemate
content: Parliament Budget Session LIVE Updates: Both Houses of Parliament are set to hold the general discussion on the Union Budget 2026-27 today.

title: Video: US Plane Lands On Busy Road In Georgia, Crashes Into Several Cars
content: A small plane crashed into multiple vehicles on a busy road in Georgia, US, during an emergency landing on Monday.

title: Supreme Court Again Urges Centre To Reconsider Sonam Wangchuk's Detention
content: The Supreme Court once again asked the Central government to reconsider the detention of climate activist Sonam Wangchuk after noting concerns about his deteriorating health.

title: "If I Died Like Nirbhaya, Everyone Would Have Believed": Unnao Rape Survivor
content: The Unnao rape survivor on Monday expressed relief after the Supreme Court of India rejected the bail plea of expelled BJP leader Kuldeep Singh Sengar in connection with the custodial death of her father.

title: 'Attack, Don't Negotiate': Iranian's Video Appeal To Trump Before Death By Suicide
content: An Iranian man has reportedly died by suicide after posting a social media video of himself urging US President Donald Trump not to make a deal with Iran's theocratic regime.

title: US Cuts Bangladesh Tariffs By 1%, Zero Reciprocal Tariff On Certain Goods
content: The United States and Bangladesh unveiled a deal Monday to lower US tariffs on goods from the world's second-biggest garment manufacturer, with Washington also committing to work towards duty exemptions for certain textiles and apparel.

title: BJP's Manjusha Nagpur Elected Unopposed As Pune Mayor
content: Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) corporator Manjusha Nagpure was elected unopposed as mayor of the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) on Monday, while RPI (A) leader Parshuram Wadekar became deputy mayor.

title: Land Allotted For Islamic Institution Comes Under Scrutiny In Uttarakhand
content: The transfer of nearly 20 acres of land located close to the Indian Military Academy (IMA) here, allegedly for constructing an Islamic educational institution, has come under scrutiny.

title: Himanta Sarma "Is Not Chanakya": Gaurav Gogoi On 'Pak Link' Allegations
content: Assam Congress President and Jorhat MP, Gaurav Gogoi, on Monday hit back at Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma's 'Pakistan link' allegations.

title: Aviation Body Issued 352 Show Cause Notices To Airlines In Last 2 Years
content: Aviation watchdog DGCA issued 352 show cause notices to scheduled commercial airlines for various violations in the last two years, according to government data.

title: "Sanatan Will Face Existential Crisis If...": Yogi Adityanath Warns
content: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath on Monday said if the nation becomes weak, Sanatan will face an "existential crisis", cautioning people to stay alert against those who try to divide society.

title: ISRO Fast-Tracks India's Space Station Plans, 80 Satellites In Pipeline
content: India is making rapid progress towards establishing its own space station while simultaneously advancing the Gaganyaan human spaceflight mission, ISRO Programme Director Imtiyaz Ahmed said on Monday.

title: "No Discussion With Me": Shashi Tharoor On Motion Against Lok Sabha Speaker
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Monday said he has not been consulted regarding the Opposition's plan to move a no-confidence motion against Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla, even as he acknowledged being aware of the intention.

title: Allahabad High Court quashes criminal case against RWA office-bearers, flags misuse of RSS name
content: Says the general body of the society had passed a board resolution, framing parking guidelines to avoid traffic obstruction and hence nothing was done illegally.

title: EC using ‘very restrictive’ software tools unable to fathom ‘natural differences’, says Supreme Court
content: Top court asks poll body to extend claims-objections phase deadline by a week from February 14, directs West Bengal DGP to file a personal affidavit on allegations of violence, burning of documents

title: India, Greece to strengthen defence partnership, expand capacity of military industries
content: “Both Ministers reiterated that the partnership is rooted in shared values of peace, stability, freedom and mutual respect,” says Ministry of Defence

title: Kanpur pan masala baron’s son booked after reckless car crash
content: At least six persons were injured after a speeding Lamborghini, allegedly driven by Shivam Mishra rammed into pedestrians and two-wheelers on VIP Road in Kanpur’s upscale Gwaltoli area

title: Rahul has no interest in meaningful debate: BJP
content: BJP MP Anil Baluni called it the “height of irony”, that “a party which signed an MoU with the Communist Party of China now seeks to lecture the nation on security”.

title: Foreign Secretary Misri doesn’t refute Trump’s claims, says ‘national interests’ guide oil imports
content: Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri says import of oil decided by “adequate availability, fair pricing, and reliability of supply”; government set to brief parliamentary committee on trade deals with EU and the U.S.

title: Karnataka origin man working for LTIMindtree shot dead in Canada
content: Chandan Kumar, originally from Tyamagondlu, Nelamangala taluk, Bengaluru Rural district of Karnataka, was an Information Technology professional

title: Opposition corners Centre over unemployment, farmers’ woes during discussion on Budget in Rajya Sabha
content: Senior Congress leader P. Chidambaram said it was a ‘forgettable’ Budget, prepared by ‘a Finance Minister who forgot her promises made in this House last year’. Of 144 crore people in the country, less than two crore were employed in factories, he said and flagged the poor outcome of the PM’s internship scheme.

title: Congress plans grassroots reboot in T.N., new district chiefs head to Delhi for orientation
content: The Congress undertook Sangathan Srijan Abhiyan (SSA), a State-wide restructuring of its district units, identifying active grassroots leaders, and elevating them to organisational roles

title: Support of public needed to combat  cancer, says CM
content: Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan said a Cancer Control Board had been formed at the government level for early diagnosis and disease prevention

title: Fisherfolk protest at site of proposed Mamallan Reservoir
content: According to a community leader, the fishing community was not given any opportunity to raise objections to the project that will lead to thousands of families losing their livelihoods

title: Gaurav Gogoi threatens to sue Himanta, says CM is ‘trapped’
content: Congress MP Gaurav Gogoi slams Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma for making public information about his minor children; he terms the SIT report against him ‘bogus’

title: Delhi CM Rekha Gupta launches new air monitoring stations, calls for year-round pollution control
content: Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta on Monday said pollution control needs sustained, year-round action as she inaugurated six new Continuous Ambient Air Quality Monitoring System (CAAQMS) stations across the capital.

title: Producer of Rajinikanth’s Kochadaiiyaan should pay fine of ₹2.52 crore or go to jail, orders Madras High Court
content: Justice Sunder Mohan confirms conviction of Murali Manohar in cheque bounce case but modifies six month sentence to just payment of fine

title: GPS, drone survey identify tax evasion in 10,000 properties in Bengaluru
content: Nearly 49,000 show-cause notices, roughly one for each year of underpayment, have been generated for these 10,000 properties

title: Action sought against YSRCP leaders over alleged adulteration of Tirumala laddu
content: Religious leaders and devotees stage protest at Alipiri in Tirupati, demand fast-track court and probe by a sitting judge into alleged use of adulterated ghee in laddu Prasadam during the previous regime

title: A.P. is poised to become ‘eastern gateway of global logistics’, says official
content: The government’s endeavour is to have the lowest logistics cost in India, for which a plan has been prepared, and efforts have started to achieve that goal, says Special Chief Secretary Krishna Babu

title: Pawan Kalyan lauds forest officials for safe capture of transient tiger
content: Tiger tranquilised after roaming across four States for 53 days; rehabilitation meeting with WII experts deferred to February 10

title: Kerala High Court orders VACB probe into gold ‘theft’ from Sabarimala flag mast
content: The Division Bench says it may not be appropriate to entrust the probe to the SIT investigating other serious and similar offences at the temple. It passes interim order after SIT submits details of plaint in connection with installation of a new flagpole mast in 2017

title: Why this post on Indian parenting made so many people say, ‘this is my story’
content: An eye-catching social media post has gone viral, igniting a debate on 'pressure cooker parenting' in India, where children are molded into success stories instead of embraced as individuals. This mindset elevates accomplishments over inquisitive minds and emotional wellness, with parents often transferring their own unmet dreams onto their offspring.

title: 75+ Happy Teddy Day Messages, Greetings, Wishes and Quotes for 2026
content: Valentine's Week continues with Teddy Day on February 10, celebrating love's nurturing side through gifting teddy bears. This gesture symbolizes care and comfort, ideal for expressing affection, especially for those in long-distance relationships or seeking to reconnect. The article offers various wishes, messages, and quotes to convey these sentiments.

title: Shami, Ishan Kishan among five players dropped from BCCI central contracts
content: The BCCI's central contracts for 2025-26 see several prominent names like Mohammed Shami and Ishan Kishan excluded, with the A+ category abolished. Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma are moved to Group B, while Shubman Gill enters Group A alongside Jasprit Bumrah and Ravindra Jadeja. Sai Sudharsan is the sole new male entrant.

title: Former child actor Blake Garrett passes away at 33
content: Former child actor Blake Garrett, celebrated for his role in 'How to Eat Fried Worms,' has passed away at 33. His mother confirmed his death in Tulsa, Oklahoma. While the cause is under investigation, he had recently been diagnosed with shingles. Garrett, who began his acting journey at eight, also appeared in 'Barney's Colorful World, Live!' and various stage productions. Some of his stage productions include 'Grease' and 'Peanuts: A Charlie Brown Tribute.'

title: Won't let SIR be stalled, or genuine voters left out: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court firmly stated it will not permit any delays in the special intensive revision of voter rolls across 12 states. While extending a document submission deadline by a week, the court sought an affidavit from Bengal's DGP regarding alleged TMC efforts to disrupt the process.

title: Cavaliers vs Nuggets injury report: Who’s playing and who’s out
content: Cleveland Cavaliers visit Denver Nuggets on February 9th, a clash of conference leaders. Both teams face significant injury concerns, potentially impacting rotations and matchups. Cleveland aims to improve playoff seeding with strong defense and rebounding, while Denver seeks to maintain home advantage despite key player absences. Availability of stars like Jokic and Murray will be crucial.

title: Bassist Fred Smith passes away at 77
content: Veteran bassist Fred Smith, a pivotal figure in the rise of punk rock and new wave, has died at 77. Known for his work with Television and Blondie, Smith was celebrated for his melodic basslines and essential contributions to songs. His bandmate Jimmy Rip shared heartfelt tributes, remembering Smith's humor and musical talent. Smith passed away from cancer complications.

title: Amaravati expansion, irrigation projects likely to dominate A.P. Budget session starting Feb. 11
content: Governor to address joint session on the opening day; Finance Minister to present Budget on February 14, ruling NDA to target YSR Congress Party over attendance of its members in the House

title: Pinarayi lashes out at Assam CM over video targeting Muslims
content: Such nefarious attempts to normalise hate for electoral gains are an affront to our Constitution, says Kerala Chief Minister about a video posted on Assam BJP’s official social media accounts that showed Mr. Sarma appearing to shoot at framed photographs of Muslims

title: A.P. targets to reduce average power purchase cost to ₹3.90 per unit by 2035
content: The State is progressing towards net-zero emissions through green hydrogen production, by building smart grids, increasing the penetration of rooftop solar power, says Vijayanand

title: Super Bowl 2026 commercials that feature athletes: Serena, Peyton and Hall of Fame tight ends
content: the ads feature athletes during super Bowl LX between the new England Patriots and Seattle Seahawks . the ads are often priceless, but the right ad can be priceless . there's often a hefty price attached to commercials, and this year is no different .

title: From Josh Howlin to Barker Playfield: NFL-inspired pups headline Puppy Bowl XXII
content: the Seattle Seahawks and new England Patriots have a roster ready for the spotlight . team Fluff is a terrier-beagle from Nickel City Canine Rescue in Buffalo . she's joined by Barker Playfield, a nod to quarterback Baker Mayfield .

title: See in photos how the Seahawks stopped the run and won the Super Bowl
content: The defense doesn't often take center stage in the NFL's championship game, but the  Seattle Seahawks ' unit took over in its  29-13 win  against the  New England Patriots  in Santa Clara, California Sunday night. The Patriots were scoreless in their 10 possessions of the game, tying the Colts (Super Bowl III) for the fourth-longest drought to begin a Super Bowl, according to Elias Sports Bureau. The Seahawks' defense held the Patriots to four first downs, 51 total yards, 2.0 yards per play and three sacks in the first half. We captured the plays that secured the Seahawks their second Super Bowl win.

title: Who will hoist the Heisman in 2026? A way-too-early look
content: mendoza led the Hoosiers to a perfect 13-0 regular-season record . he beat out quarterbacks Diego Pavia, Julian Sayin and Jeremiyah Love to take home the trophy . there's a whole new crop of Heisman Trophy candidates for 2026 .

title: Best moments: The Bay records first win of the season over Los Angeles
content: The Bay beat los angeles 11-5 in a high-stakes match on tuesday night . the match was the first of its kind in the playoffs for the first time . a scoreless start through the first two holes of the match swung in The Bay's favor .

title: Bad Bunny hosts wedding during Super Bowl LX halftime show
content: the couple featured in Bad Bunny's super bowl LX halftime performance was legally married . the couple was spotlighted several times during the show, beginning with a proposal early on . they got married surrounded by backup dancers .

title: Baseball is back! The stars, teams and themes we can't wait to see in spring training
content: the new york Mets capped an offseason overhaul with a trade for ace Freddy Peralta . the defending champion los Angeles Dodgers made the biggest splash when they inked no. 1 free agent Kyle Tucker to a four-year, $240 million deal .

title: 'Go Hawks': Russell Wilson tops reaction to Seahawks' Super Bowl LX title
content: the Seattle Seahawks have won the Super Bowl for the second time in franchise history . the Patriots did not score on any of their first 10 possessions of the game . they tied with the Indianapolis Colts in super Bowl III for the fourth-longest streak .

title: 🎵 Social reaction to Bad Bunny's halftime show
content: Bad Bunny gave fans nearly 13 minutes of energetic entertainment . he opened the performance with "Tit Me Preguntó" and transitioned to "Yo Perreo Sola" the sports world was well represented in the show .

title: 2026 Winter Olympics: U.S. women's hockey shuts out Switzerland and more from Monday
content: Monday's events at the Milan Cortina Olympics have concluded, with Eileen Gu, a three-time medalist in Beijing, winning silver in women's ski slopestyle and Switzerland's  Mathilde Gremaud winning gold . The U.S. women's hockey team shut out Switzerland 5-0, with Caroline Harvey scoring three points in the win. U.S. stars Madison Chock and Evan Bates took second in rhythm dance, falling just 0.46 behind France's Laurence Fournier Beaudry and Guillaume Cizeron. Meanwhile, Jutta Leerdam of the Netherlands -- the fiancée of boxer Jake Paul -- scored an Olympic gold in the women's 1,000-meter speedskating final with a time of 1:12.31, setting an Olympic record. Here are the top moments from Monday's events.
